title: Position vs time graph from velocity time graph

content.question: The graph above shows velocity v versus time t for an object in linear motion. Which of the following is a possible graph of position x versus time t for this object?

choices.label: Five answer choices are shown. All of the choices are graphs with position on the y-axis and time on the x-axis and three evenly spaced tick marks on the x-axis to the right of the origin. Choice A starts at the origin and increases linearly until the first tick mark, is concave down and increasing to halfway between the first and second tick marks, is concave down and decreasing to the second tick mark, and decreases linearly back to the x-axis between the second and third tick marks.

Five answer choices are shown. All of the choices are graphs with position on the y-axis and time on the x-axis and three evenly spaced tick marks on the x-axis to the right of the origin. Choice B starts at the origin and is horizontal along the x-axis until the first tick mark, then is horizontal at a negative position until the second tick mark, then is horizontal along the x-axis until the third tick marks. The horizontal sections are connected by vertical lines.

Five answer choices are shown. All of the choices are graphs with position on the y-axis and time on the x-axis and three evenly spaced tick marks on the x-axis to the right of the origin. Choice C starts at a value on the y-axis above the origin and is horizontal until the first tick mark, then decreases linearly to the same distance it started at but below the origin, then is horizontal at this negative value until the third tick mark.

Five answer choices are shown. All of the choices are graphs with position on the y-axis and time on the x-axis and three evenly spaced tick marks on the x-axis to the right of the origin. Choice D starts at a value on the y-axis above the origin and is concave down and decreasing until it hits the x-axis halfway between the first and second tick marks. Then it is concave down and increasing, returning to its initial height at the third tick mark.

Five answer choices are shown. All of the choices are graphs with position on the y-axis and time on the x-axis and three evenly spaced tick marks on the x-axis to the right of the origin. Choice E starts at the origin and increases linearly to a distance above the x-axis at the first tick mark, then decreases linearly between the first and second tick marks to the same distance below the x-axis, then increases linearly until ending on the x-axis at the third tick mark.

content.answer: Five answer choices are shown. All of the choices are graphs with position on the y-axis and time on the x-axis and three evenly spaced tick marks on the x-axis to the right of the origin. Choice A starts at the origin and increases linearly until the first tick mark, is concave down and increasing to halfway between the first and second tick marks, is concave down and decreasing to the second tick mark, and decreases linearly back to the x-axis between the second and third tick marks.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
